column4: hello can someone help me please...once i login in gnome, multiple gnome-screenshot applications start running until the system crashes...plus now that i am using issi.irc, \\\\\\\ these start being written on their own...anyone??
: tried a different keyboard? sounds like keys are getting stuck
it is a laptop  and it does not happen under windows
ok another question as no one can help me...does anyone know why when i go to save something on a usb stick or a floppy, it tells me that it is copied but when i try it is has not been copied???
: ok. just thought I'd try the simple solution first, There could be an some form of incompatibility with special keys on your laptop,
this suddently happened yesterday for no reason..until then it was fine
i am in no mood to sit an reformat the system...it will take ages to set it up again
: i'm just trying to think what else it could be. It's certainly an odd problem!
i will try removing gnome-screensaver completely to see if it will work
: ok, but what would gnome-screensaver have to do with it?
in relation to why i cannot always write on my usb stick or floppy when it says it has done so??any ideas there?
well that is what is running all the time..so it might have a bug or something
i dont know why \\\\ happens though
there's a delay in writing to usb sticks. wait a while before removing it.

: i can't see any particular reason why gnome-screensaver is causing problems with your print-screen and \\\\\\ problem, the only thing I can think of at the moment is to select a different keyboard layout from System -> Preferences and then changing it back. It might reset keyboard problems
